intro: Adenostemma nutans, commonly known as the nodding adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in the summer months. Adenostemma nutans is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its medicinal properties have been explored in traditional herbal practices, though further scientific research is needed to confirm its therapeutic potential.
